etymology.description: Pictogram (象形): rope wrapped around two pieces of wood to keep them straight; later borrowed phonetically for “no”. The derivative 拂 stands for the original word.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts two sticks bound by a cord to keep them straight. Its common negative meaning arose from a phonetic loan, unrelated to the original image. The concrete sense later shifted to the character 拂.

examples.chinese: 他对命令弗从(他對命令弗從)。
examples.english: He did not comply with the order.

examples.chinese: 吾弗知其故(吾弗知其故)。
examples.english: I do not know the reason.

examples.chinese: 医者仁心(醫者仁心)，弗可欺(弗可欺)。
examples.pinyin: yī zhě rén xīn, fú kě qī.
examples.english: Physicians are benevolent; they must not be deceived.
